alert.note: Alert for Collier (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 29 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Northern portions of Collier County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ave Maria, Immokalee, Golden Gate Estates, Big Corkscrew Island, Orangetree, Big Cypress National Preserve, Lake Trafford, Bunker Hill, Sunniland and Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
